alert.note: Alert for San Miguel; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 2:13PM MDT until July 21 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN SANTA FE AND NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES... At 213 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have ended across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cowles and Tererro. This includes the following highways... State Road 63 between Mile Markers 15 and 25. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
